messages.messageBody:
--- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, "Betsy and Chris"
<canderson51@c...> wrote:
> I am just learning about unschooling, but I am really nodding my
head in agreement with what I've found so far. It feels like jumping
off a cliff--scary and freeing at the same time. I have a lot of
deschooling to do.


Hi Betsy, welcome to the list! About your cliff analogy, this is a
paraphrase of something i read somewhere about HSing: Homeschooling
is like jumping off a cliff until you realize that you and your
child both have wings to FLY!

Katherine

messages.subject: Hi! Hello. Nice to meet you!
messages.msgSnippet: Just thought I d take a minute to introduce myself and offer up a few words of thanks. My name is Betsy. I have a 2.5 year old boy named Sam. He is
messages.messageBody:
Just thought I'd take a minute to introduce myself and offer up a few words of thanks.

My name is Betsy. I have a 2.5 year old boy named Sam. He is incredible--I had no idea I would be this blown away!

I am just learning about unschooling, but I am really nodding my head in agreement with what I've found so far. It feels like jumping off a cliff--scary and freeing at the same time. I have a lot of deschooling to do.

I am enjoying this list and the links and the resources tremendously! Every day my mind gets blown open in ways I can't believe--it's pretty cool!

Anyway, I will continue to read and learn and try to participate.

Thanks so much,
Betsy

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
